hadiths.text: It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said:“The Prophet (ﷺ) was in need of food, and news of that reached 'Ali. He went out seeking work so that he could earn something to give to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). He came to a garden belonging to a Jewish man, and he drew seventeen buckets of water for him, each bucket for a date. The Jew gave him the option to take seventeen of his 'Ajwah dates (a high quality of dates) and he brought them to the Prophet of Allah (ﷺ).”

chapter.ara-name: باب الرَّجُلِ يَسْتَقِي كُلَّ دَلْوٍ بِتَمْرَةٍ وَيَشْتَرِطُ جَلْدَةً
chapter.eng-name: A Man Who Draws A Bucket Of Water In Return For A Date And Stipulates That They Must Be G
